intro: Andropogon trinii, commonly known as three-branched grass, is a perennial grass species native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies, preferring moist to wet soils. The plant has slender, upright stems that are often丛生, with narrow, linear leaves that are smooth and glossy. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are often reddish in color. Andropogon trinii plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
